abstract: Google promises that its Chrome operating system will put an emphasis on speed, simplicity and security.
snippet: Google promises that its Chrome operating system will put an emphasis on speed, simplicity and security.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  If at times you’re frustrated with your PC  and who isn’t?  Google says it is working on a solution.

headline.main: In Chrome, Hints of a Real Rival to Windows
headline.print_headline: In Chrome, Hints of a Real Rival to Windows

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Ashlee Vance

abstract: Google’s new operating system is likely to create more questions for regulators investigating its shared board members with Apple.
snippet: Google’s new operating system is likely to create more questions for regulators investigating its shared board members with Apple.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  As Google prepares to unveil its own operating system, based on its Chrome browser, all eyes are on its intensifying competition with the software giant Microsoft.

headline.main: Google Operating System Raises Apple Antitrust Issues
headline.print_headline: Google Operating System Raises Apple Antitrust Issues

abstract: Google is threatening to displace Microsoft Windows on consumer PCs. But new software tools also make the operating system far less important to big data centers and software developers.
snippet: Google is threatening to displace Microsoft Windows on consumer PCs. But new software tools also make the operating system far less important to big data centers and software developers.
lead_paragraph: Google’s new Chrome operating system is a challenge to Microsoft in several ways. It will offer a free rival to Windows, which can add $25 to $100 to the price of a computer. But it also represents a conceptual slap at the elaborate array of features that make up the soon-to-be-unveiled Windows 7.

abstract: No sooner did my review of Microsoft Bing appear on the Web yesterday than the hate mail began pouring in. In general, I liked the new search service. But here’s the beefs.
snippet: No sooner did my review of Microsoft Bing appear on the Web yesterday than the hate mail began pouring in. In general, I liked the new search service. But here’s the beefs.
lead_paragraph: Well, I should have known that if I used the word "Microsoft" in a sentence, I'd hear from the haters.

headline.main: Giving Credit Where Credit Is Due (Yes, to Microsoft)
headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue

abstract: David Pogue reviews Microsoft's new search engine, Bing.
snippet: David Pogue reviews Microsoft's new search engine, Bing.
lead_paragraph: David Pogue reviews Microsoft's new search engine, Bing.
